00020 #include "util/AptVersionInfo.h"
00021 #include "util/md5sum.h"
00022 #include "util/PgOptions.h"
00023 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00024 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvFile.h"
00025 #include "util/FsPath.h"
00026 #include "util/Fs.h"
00027 
00028 using namespace std;
00029 using namespace affx;
00030 
00031 /**
00032  * Define the options for the program.
00033  * @param opts The command line options.
00034  */
00035 static void define_options(PgOptions* opts)
00036 {
00037         opts->setUsage("apt-md5-check - check the integrity of files given an MD5 value file.\n"
00038                 "The MD5 value file is a tab delimited text file with two columns: \"File\" and \"MD5\"\n\n"
00039                 "usage:\n"
00040                 "   apt-md5-check -a <application> -i <md5-file.rpt>");
00041         opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00042                 "This message.",
00043                 "false");
00044         opts->defineOption("i", "", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00045                 "The MD5 value file.",
00046                 "");
00047         opts->defineOption("a", "", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00048                 "The name of the application that generated the MD5 value file.",
00049                 "");
00050         opts->defineOption("s", "", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00051                 "Text to add to the file contents when calculating MD5 values.",
00052                 "");
00053         opts->defineOption("v", "", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00054                 "The verbosity: 0 = normal, 2 = detailed messages",
00055                 "0");
00056         opts->defineOption("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00057                 "Display version information.",
00058                 "false");
00059 }
00060 
00061 /** 
00062  * Determine the salt value based on the command line inputs and known application salts
00063  * @param opts The command line options
00064  * @return The salt value to use when computing the MD5.
00065  */
00066 static string determineSalt(PgOptions *opts)
00067 {
00068         string salt = opts->get("s");
00069         if (salt.empty() == true)
00070         {
00071                 string app = opts->get("a");
00072                 if (app == "DMET Console")
00073                         salt = "salt";
00074         }
00075         return salt;
00076 }
00077 
00078 /**
00079  * Check the MD5 values stored in the input file versus a newly computed value.
00080  * @param opts The command line options
00081  * @return The number of files that do not match the MD5.
00082  */
00083 static int checkFiles(PgOptions* opts)
00084 {
00085         int nerrors = 0;
00086         string salt=determineSalt(opts);
00087         string file;
00088         string md5value;
00089         md5sum md5;
00090         string fileMd5;
00091 
00092         string md5File = opts->get("i");
00093         if (Fs::exists(md5File) == false)
00094                 throw string("The input file does not exist");
00095         FsPath base(md5File);
00096         string basePath = base.getDirName();
00097 
00098         Verbose::setLevel(opts->getInt("v"));
00099 
00100         TsvFile tsv;
00101         if (tsv.open(md5File) != affx::TSV_OK) {
00102                 Err::errAbort("Unable to open the MD5 file.");
00103         }
00104         tsv.bind(0, "File", &file, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00105         tsv.bind(0, "MD5", &md5value, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00106 
00107         while (tsv.nextLine() == TSV_OK)
00108         {
00109                 Verbose::out(2, "Checking: " + file);
00110                 Verbose::out(2, "MD5: " + md5value);
00111 
00112                 md5.ofFile(Fs::join(basePath, file), fileMd5, salt);
00113                 Verbose::out(2, "Calculated MD5: " + fileMd5);
00114                 if (fileMd5 != md5value)
00115                 {
00116                         ++nerrors;
00117                         Verbose::out(0, "The MD5 value does not match for: " + file);
00118                 }
00119                 else
00120                 {
00121                         Verbose::out(0, "The MD5 value matches for: " + file);
00122                 }
00123 
00124                 Verbose::out(2, "");
00125         }
00126 
00127         tsv.close();
00128 
00129         return nerrors;
00130 }
00131 
00132 /** 
00133  * The main entry point.
00134  * @return The number of files that do not match the input MD5 values.
00135  */
00136 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00137 {
00138         int nerrors = 0;
00139         try
00140         {
00141                 const string version = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00142 
00143                 PgOptions *opts = new PgOptions();
00144                 define_options(opts);
00145                 opts->parseArgv(argv);
00146 
00147                 // Do we need help?
00148                 if(opts->getBool("help") || argc == 1)
00149                 {
00150                         opts->usage();
00151                         cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00152                 }
00153                 // Show version number
00154                 else if(opts->getBool("version"))
00155                 {
00156                         cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00157                 }
00158                 // Check the MD5 values.
00159                 else
00160                 {
00161                         nerrors = checkFiles(opts);
00162                 }
00163                 delete opts;
00164         }
00165         catch(string err)
00166         {
00167                 Verbose::out(1, "ERROR: " + err);
00168                 nerrors = -1;
00169         }
00170         catch(...)
00171         {
00172                 Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00173                 nerrors = -1;
00174         }
00175         return nerrors;
00176 }
